content.title: Error in thomas-iniguez-visioli/youtube-public: [GoogleGenerativeAI Error]: Error fetching from ht...
content.body:
### Error Details
- **Repository:** thomas-iniguez-visioli/youtube-public
- **Event:** issues
- **Action:** opened
- **Error Message:** [GoogleGenerativeAI Error]: Error fetching from https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/gemini-2.5-flash:generateContent: [429 Too Many Requests] You exceeded your current quota, please check your plan and billing details. For more information on this error, head to: https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/rate-limits. To monitor your current usage, head to: https://ai.dev/rate-limit. 
* Quota exceeded for metric: generativelanguage.googleapis.com/generate_content_free_tier_requests, limit: 20, model: gemini-2.5-flash
Please retry in 21.111935513s. content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The GitHub Action, when encountering a `429 Too Many Requests` error from the Google Generative AI API, should implement a retry mechanism with exponential backoff.
The action should successfully complete its `generateContent` call after retrying, provided the quota is not persistently exhausted for an extended period (e.g., a full day).

If the `429` error persists after a configurable number of retries or indicates a hard daily quota limit, the action should log a clear, actionable message about the quota exhaustion and fail gracefully rather than crashing.

fileActions.explanation: To understand the current implementation of Gemini API calls and where to integrate retry logic for 429 errors.
To understand how the `IssueAnalyzer` and `GeminiClient` are utilized in the workflow and where higher-level error handling or retry coordination could be managed.
To understand the main entry point of the GitHub Action and how the workflow manager is invoked, which might influence global retry settings or API key management.
